On Saturday, March 20, 2004, at 3:46:49 AM, Curt Sampson wrote:

> On Fri, 19 Mar 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>> I understand the documentation is old. That's why Mike Clark and I each
>> wrote well-known, widely-read tutorials on JUnit. They just aren't in
>> the JUnit distribution.

> Well, documentation aside, I find the naming of the classes throws me
> off a bit. When I think of a test case, I think of a single test, such
> as one testXXX method. Several of these can be put together into a
> test suite, but in JUnit you put these test cases together not into a
> TestSuite but into a TestCase. Hmmm....

I think of tests, test cases, and test suites this way:

  TestSuite (1)--->(n)TestCase(1)--->(n)Test

Ron Jeffries
www.XProgramming.com
You are closing your eyes to a situation you do not wish to acknowledge.
    --Professor Harold Hill
